member.name: T:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.FrameSpectrumCollection
member.summary: A collection of frame spectra and metadata for a single frame (or summed frame). It's purpose is to serve as a per-frame cache of data from which individual spectra may be served when called on via various MidacImsFileReader functions

member.name: F:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.FrameSpectrumCollection.m_frameNumbers
member.summary: The frame number(s) of the frame summed to produce this data

member.name: F:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.FrameSpectrumCollection.m_frameBinRecords
member.summary: References to the FrameBin records for those frames

member.name: F:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.FrameSpectrumCollection.m_driftBins
member.summary: A list of the drift bins for which there is a frame MS with non-zero abundance in this frame. Zero corresponds to the first non-TFS spectrum's drift bin (which is 1 in the data file, 0 is used for the TFS).

member.name: F:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.FrameSpectrumCollection.m_scanBinRecords
member.summary: The MsScanBinRecord for each drift bin with a non-empty spectrum

member.name: F:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.FrameSpectrumCollection.m_specIters
member.summary: The spectrum abundance iterator for each non-empty spectrum

member.name: F:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.FrameSpectrumCollection.m_metrics
member.summary: The RLZ metrics for each non-empty spectrum

member.summary: Is this collection for the same set of frame numbers specified?

member.summary: Get the FrameBinRecord for a specified frame, if stored here (else null)
Add info about the frame spectra
member.param: The drift bins (0 = first non-TFS frame spectrum)
The MsScanBinRecords
The abundance iterators
The iterator metrics

member.name: T:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.MidacFileAccess

member.summary: Checks (without opening the file) whether a specified file is a MassHunter IMS data file.
member.param: Full path name of the file, e.g., C:\My\Path\stuff.d

member.name: M:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.MidacFileAccess.ImsDataReader(System.String)
member.summary: Returns a reader capable of accessing data from a MassHunter IMS data file, already opened to that file.

member.name: M:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.MidacFileAccess.MsDataReader(System.String)
member.summary: Returns a reader capable of accessing data from a MassHunter traditional MS data file, already opened to that file.

member.summary: Instantiate and return MS Spectrum filters with default values (no filtering)

member.summary: Instantiate and return MS Chromatogram filters with default values (no filtering)

member.summary: An implementation of IMidacImsReader

member.summary: An interface used to access MassHunter IM-MS data files

member.name: M:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacImsReader.OpenFile(System.String)
member.summary: Opens the specified data file after first closing any currently-open file.

member.name: M:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacImsReader.Close
member.summary: Terminate access to the current IMS data file and clear all contents of this object.

member.name: M:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacImsReader.FilteredFrameNumbers(Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacMsFiltersSpec)
member.summary: Get a collection of all frame (scan) numbers for which the mass spectra meet specified filter criteria.
member.param: If null or if filters.ApplicableFilters is Unspecified, returns a list of all frame numbers in the file

member.name: M:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacImsReader.FilteredFrameNumbers(Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacMsFiltersChrom)
member.summary: Get a collection of all frame (scan) numbers for which the data meet specified filter criteria for inclusion in chromatograms.
member.param: If null or if filters.ApplicableFilters is Unspecified, returns a list of all frame numbers in the file

member.name: M:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacImsReader.FilteredAcqTimes(Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacMsFiltersSpec)
member.summary: Get a collection of all frame (scan) acquisition times (aka retention times) for which the mass spectra meet specified filter criteria.
member.param: If null or if filters.ApplicableFilters is Unspecified, returns the times of all frames in the file.

member.name: M:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacImsReader.CcsFromDriftTime(System.Double,System.Int32,System.Double)
member.summary: If HasCcsCalibration returns true, this will compute the CCS corresponding to a specified ion observed in this data file.
member.param: The m/z of the ion whose CCS is desired
The (unsigned) charge state of the specified ion, 1 or greater
The observed drift time of the ion
member.returns: The cross section. NaN if HasCcsCalibration is false or if required information is missing

member.name: M:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacImsReader.DriftTimeFromCcs(System.Double,System.Int32,System.Double)
member.summary: If HasCcsCalibration returns true, this will compute the drift time (in milliseconds) that an ion with a specified CCS (and z and m/z) would have in this file.
member.param: The m/z of an ion whose drift time (in milliseconds) is desired
The (unsigned) charge state of the specified ion, 1 or greater
The collision cross section of the ion
member.returns: The drift time. NaN if HasCcsCalibration is false or if required information is missing

member.summary: Get frame-specific metadata for a specific frame
member.remarks: Abundance range is empty, as this doesn't access spectrum records

member.summary: Get a list of the drift bin numbers for which a specified frame has mass spectra with non-zero abundnace.

member.summary: Get a unit converter that bases its conversions on values from one specfied frame

member.summary: Get frame-specific metadata that represents a summary for a specified list of frames
member.remarks: Abundance range is empty, as this doesn't access spectrum records

member.name: M:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacImsReader.NonEmptyDriftBins(System.Int32[])
member.summary: Get a list of the drift bin numbers for which the sum of specified frames has mass spectra with non-zero abundance

member.name: M:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacImsReader.FrameUnitConverter(System.Int32[])
member.summary: Get a unit converter that bases its conversions on values averaged over a specified set of frames.

member.name: M:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacImsReader.ProfileTotalFrameMs(Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.MidacSpecFormat,System.Int32)
member.summary: Get the profile TFS from a specified frame
member.param: The format in which the spectrum is to be returned, one of Profile, ZeroTrimmed, or ZeroBound.
The number of the frame whose TFS is to be read.
member.returns: Null if the file doesn't have profile TFS spectra or if the specified frame number does not exist. Else, the desired spectrum. A returned spectrum will have empty X and Y arrays if it has no nonzero-abundance points (and null data arrays for specFormat == Metadata).

member.name: M:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacImsReader.ProfileTotalFrameMs(Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.MidacSpecFormat,Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacMsFiltersSpec,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Get a combined profile TFS from the frames meeting specified filter criteria.
member.param: The format in which the spectra are to be returned, one of Profile, ZeroTrimmed, or ZeroBound.
If null or if filters.ApplicableFilters is Unspecified, the returned spectrum includes all frames in the file
True if the returned spectrum should be the sum of the individual spectra; false if the returned spectrum should be an average
member.returns: Null if the file doesn't have profile TFS spectra or if there are frames number with data meeting the specified filters. Else the desired spectrum, or an array of spectra if the specified frames have spectra of types that cannot be mixed. Any returned spectrum may have empty X and Y arrays if it has no nonzero-abundance points (and null data arrays for specFormat == Metadata).
member.remarks: The same operation can be done by calling FilteredFrameNumbers (with MsStorageType == ProfileSpectra), and passing the frame number array to the ProfileTotalFrameMs function with a frame number array parameter.

member.name: M:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacImsReader.ProfileTotalFrameMs(Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.MidacSpecFormat,System.Int32[],System.Boolean)
member.summary: Get a combined profile TFS from a list of specified frames.
member.param: The format in which the spectra are to be returned, one of Profile, ZeroTrimmed, or ZeroBound.
The frames whose TFS spectra are to be combined
True if the returned spectrum should be the sum of the individual spectra; false if the returned spectrum should be an average
member.returns: Null if the file doesn't have profile TFS spectra or if none of the specified frames exist in the file. Else, the desired spectrum, or an array of spectra if the specified frames have spectra of types that cannot be mixed. Any returned spectrum may have empty X and Y arrays if it has no nonzero-abundance points (and null data arrays for specFormat == Metadata).
member.remarks: Examples of "non-mixable" spectra include those with different ion polarities, different MS levels or spectra from different scan segments. However, data acquisition in IM-MS mode does not yet support multiple ion polarities or multiple scan segments, so mixed MSLevels is currently the only practical example of this. Note that spectra with different fragmentation energies ARE combined.

member.name: M:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacImsReader.PeakDetectedTotalFrameMs(System.Int32,Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacPeakFilters,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Get a total frame spectrum (centroided) from a specified frame.
member.param: The number of the frame whose TFS is to be read
If not null, peak filters that may be used to reduce the number of peaks included in the returned spectrum.
If true and the specified frame doesn't have a peak-detected spectrum, then one is created from the frame's profile spectrum.
member.remarks: This may be time consuming. A value for pkFilters must be specified.

member.name: M:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacImsReader.PeakDetectedTotalFrameMs(System.Int32[],System.Boolean,Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacPeakFilters,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Get a combined, peak-detected total frame spectrum from specified frame numbers.
member.param: The frames whose TFS spectra are to be combined
True if the returned spectrum should be the sum of the individual spectra; false if the returned spectrum should be an average
If not null, peak filters that may be used to reduce the number of peaks included in the spectrum.
If true and the specified frame doesn't have a peak-detected spectrum, then one is created from the frame's profile spectrum.
member.remarks: This may be time consuming. A value for pkFilters must be specified.

member.name: M:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacImsReader.FrameMs(System.Int32,System.Int32,Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.MidacSpecFormat,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Read the drift-resolved mass spectrum at a specified drift bin in a specified frame
member.param: The frame to be read
The drift bin index of the desired spectrum (0..MaxBin - 1)
The format in which the (x,y) data of the spectrum should be returned
True to use the average mass calibration for the file when computing m/z values from flight times. False to use the individual spectrum's IRM calibration when available (slower)
member.remarks: Performance for accessing many spectra is best if multiple spectra from the same frame are read in successive calls before moving on to another frame.

member.name: M:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacImsReader.FrameMs(System.Int32,System.Int32,Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.MidacSpecFormat,System.Boolean,Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacSpecDataMs@)
member.summary: Replace the data in the specified mass spectrum with that of the drift-resolved mass spectrum at a specified drift bin in a specified frame.
member.param: The frame to be read
The drift bin index of the desired spectrum (0..MaxBin - 1)
The format in which the (x,y) data of the spectrum should be returned
True to use the average mass calibration for the file when computing m/z values from flight times. False to use the individual spectrum's IRM calibration when available (slower)
the spectrum whose contents are to be replaced
member.remarks: Performance is best if the drift range is specified in units of DriftBinIndex. Performs faster than the version returning a new IMidacSpecData for each call because it can often skip allocating new memory.

member.name: M:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacImsReader.FrameMs(System.Int32,Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IDoubleRange,Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.MidacSpecFormat,System.Boolean,Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.AbundanceMeasure)
member.summary: Get a single mass spectrum that represents the sum or average of the spectra falling within a specified drift range in a specified frame.
member.param: The frame number from which spectra are combined
The drift range over which spectra are desired
The format in which the (x,y) data of the spectrum should be returned
True to use the average mass calibration for the file when computing m/z values from flight times. False to use the individual spectrum's IRM calibration when available (slower)
How spectra at different drift indices are combined; Sum or Average are expected.
member.returns: A single mass spectrum representing the specified sum or average
member.remarks: Performance is best if the drift range is specified in units of DriftBinIndex.

member.name: M:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacImsReader.FrameMs(System.Int32,Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IDoubleRange,Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.MidacSpecFormat,System.Boolean,Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.AbundanceMeasure,Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacSpecDataMs@)
member.summary: Replace the data in the specified mass spectrum with that of the sum or average of the spectra falling within a specified drift range in a specified frame.
member.param: The frame number from which spectra are combined
The drift range over which spectra are desired
The format in which the (x,y) data of the spectrum should be returned
True to use the average mass calibration for the file when computing m/z values from flight times. False to use the individual spectrum's IRM calibration when available (slower)
the spectrum whose contents are to be replaced
How spectra at different drift indices are combined; Sum or Average are expected.
member.returns: A single mass spectrum representing the specified sum or average, always in MidacSpecFormat.Profile
member.remarks: Performance is best if the drift range is specified in units of DriftBinIndex. Performs faster than the version returning a new IMidacSpecData for each call because it can often skip allocating new memory.

member.name: M:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacImsReader.FrameMs(System.Int32[],Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IDoubleRange,Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.MidacSpecFormat,System.Boolean,Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.AbundanceMeasure,Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.AbundanceMeasure)
member.summary: Get a single mass spectrum that represents the sum or average of the spectra falling within a specified drift range from specified frames.
member.param: The frame number from which spectra are combined
The drift range over which spectra are desired
The format in which the (x,y) data of the spectrum should be returned
True to use the average mass calibration for the file when computing m/z values from flight times. False to use the individual spectrum's IRM calibration when available (slower)
How spectra at different drift indices are combined; Sum or Average are expected.
How spectra from different frames are combined; Sum or Average are expected.
member.returns: A single mass spectrum representing the specified sum or average, always in MidacSpecFormat.Profile
member.remarks: Performance is best if the drift range is specified in units of DriftBinIndex.

member.name: M:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacImsReader.Chromatogram(Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.ChromatogramType,System.Boolean,Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacMsFiltersChrom)
member.summary: Extract a chromatogram described by the specified parameters. Currently only TIC is supported and filters are ignored.
member.param: The type of chromatogram to extract (TIC, BPC, EIC ...)
True if spectra acquired in a cycle (e.g., hi/low fragmentation data or files with multiple scan segments) are to be summarized with one point per cycle in the resulting chromatogram.
Controls which mass spectra are used in constructing the chromatogram.

member.name: M:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacImsReader.ChromYArrays(Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IDoubleRange[])
member.summary: Return the Y-Arrays for a collection of EICs, each extracted over a specified m/z range. Intended only for rough timing comparison with MHDAC, this uses Total Frame Spectra (there's no parameter for drift time)

member.name: P:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacImsReader.HasSingleFieldCcsInformation
member.summary: Return true if the file records the data required to convert between Collision Cross Section (CCS) and Drift Time values.

member.name: T:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacImsReaderInternal
member.summary: MidacImsreader functions with internal scope

member.name: M:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacImsReaderInternal.FilteredFrameNumbers(Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacMsFiltersSpec,System.Boolean,Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IDoubleRange[]@)
member.summary: As in the public interface, this gets a collection of all frame (scan) numbers for which the mass spectra meet specified filter criteria. Additionally, it returns info about the AcqTime ranges used.
member.param: If null or if filters.ApplicableFilters is Unspecified, returns a list of all frame numbers in the file
If false, doesn't take the time to process and return the used acqTime ranges

If AcqTimeRanges are used as filter criteria, this is a modified set of those ranges to show the ranges actually used (each range is trimmed to the limits of the qualified frames in that range and overlapping ranges are coalesced). If AcqTimeRanges are not used as filters, this is returned null.

member.name: M:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacImsReaderInternal.FilteredFrameNumbers(Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IMidacMsFiltersChrom,System.Boolean,Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.IDoubleRange[]@)
member.summary: Like the other FilteredFrameNumbers, except using the chromatogram filter interface

member.summary: Read the (non-TFS) mass spectra at all drift bins within a specified frame.
member.param: The frame to be read
The (0-based) drift bin of the first spectrum to be read
The (0-based) drift bin of the last spectrum to be read, or zero to read all spectra in the frame.
An array of spectrum iterators, one for each drift bin in the frame. A given entry may be null if the corresponding spectrum has zero recorded abundance.

member.param: The frame to be read
The drift bin of the desired spectrum (0..MaxBin - 1)

member.summary: Unpacks a spectrum iterator in the most efficient way given the desired spectrum format.

member.remarks: reference array and lists must be initialized before calling this function. Nonzero point count is NOT reset to zero here.

member.name: T:Agilent.MassSpectrometry.MIDAC.MzArrayCache
